word_mean: 锚，从船舶或其他浮体上抛入水中后能啮入底土，通过其顶端所系的锚链或缆绳提供抓力，将船舶或其他浮体系留在预定水域的专用器具。
锚，具特定形状，在抛入水中后能啮入底土提供抓持力，从而通过锚索把船或其他浮体系留于预定水域的器具。

sentence.Network_en: He remains the anchor of the country's fragile political balance.
sentence.Network_cn: 他仍然是维系该国脆弱的政治平衡的支柱。

sentence.Network_en: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
sentence.Network_cn: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。

sentence.Network_en: NATO remains the United States' chief institutional anchor in Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 北大西洋公约组织仍然是美国在欧洲首要的支柱机构。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a ship) moored by means of an anchor
(of a ship) let down the anchor and moor
(of a ship) take up the anchor when ready to start sailing

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  ancor, ancra, via Latin from Greek ankura; reinforced in Middle English  by Old French ancre. The current form is from anchora, an erroneous Latin spelling. The verb (from Old French ancrer) dates from Middle English

entry.def: An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain in order to make the boat stay in one place.
When a boat anchors or when you anchor it, its anchor is dropped into the water in order to make it stay in one place.

example.ex: We could anchor off the pier...
example.tran: 我们可以在码头附近下锚停泊。

entry.def: If you anchor an object somewhere, you fix it to something to prevent it moving from that place.

example.ex: The roots anchor the plant in the earth...
example.tran: 根部使植物固定在土壤中。

example.ex: The child seat belt was not properly anchored to the car.
example.tran: 儿童坐椅的安全带并未在车上固定到位。

entry.tran: 固定桩；系缚物；支柱；靠山
entry.def: If one thing is the anchor for something else, it makes that thing stable and secure.

example.ex: He provided an emotional anchor for her...
He remains the anchor of the country's fragile political balance.
example.tran: 他仍然是维系该国脆弱的政治平衡的支柱。

entry.tran: 与…有紧密联系;使扎根;使固守
entry.def: If something is anchored in something or to something, it has strong links with it.

example.ex: A united Germany must be firmly anchored in NATO if Europe is to remain stable...
example.tran: 欧洲要保持稳定，德国必须统一并固守北约。

example.ex: His basic outlook remains anchored in the liberal tradition.
example.tran: 他的基本观念依旧扎根于自由主义传统。

entry.tran: 主持（电视或电台节目，尤指新闻节目）
entry.def: The person who anchors a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it and acts as a link between interviews and reports which come from other places or studios.

example.ex: Viewers saw him anchoring a five-minute summary of regional news.
example.tran: 观众看见他主持一个5分钟的地方新闻摘要节目。

example.ex: ...a series of cassettes on the Vietnam War, anchored by Mr. Cronkite.
example.tran: 克朗凯特先生主持的关于越南战争的系列节目录像带

entry.tran: （尤指新闻节目的）电（视）台节目主持人
entry.def: The anchor on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it.

example.ex: He worked in the news division of ABC — he was the anchor of its 15-minute evening newscast.
example.tran: 他在美国广播公司的新闻部工作——他是晚间15分钟新闻播报的主持人。

entry.def: If a boat is at anchor, it is floating in a particular place and is prevented from moving by its anchor.

example.ex: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
example.tran: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。

entry.def: When the people on a boat drop anchor or cast anchor, they drop the boat's anchor into the water in order to prevent the boat from moving.

example.ex: We dropped anchor in a sheltered spot.
example.tran: 我们在一个能够遮风挡雨的地方下了锚。

entry.def: When the people on a boat weigh anchor or up anchor, they pull the anchor of the boat out of the water so that they can sail away.

means.word_mean: 1. a mechanical device that prevents a vessel from moving
2. a central cohesive source of support and stability;

sentences.sentence: "the keystone of campaign reform was the ban on soft money"
"he is the linchpin of this firm"

means.word_mean: 3. a television reporter who coordinates a broadcast to which several correspondents contribute
2. secure a vessel with an anchor;

auth_sentence.content: Martha Stewart shops were expected to anchor the area.
auth_sentence.res_content: Martha Stewart shops were expected to anchor the area.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Martha Stewart shops were expected to anchor the area.

auth_sentence.content: This helps anchor your body clock to these times.
auth_sentence.res_content: This helps anchor your body clock to these times.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This helps anchor your body clock to these times.

auth_sentence.content: The voices of the Shipping Forecast have weighed anchor.
auth_sentence.res_content: The voices of the Shipping Forecast have weighed anchor.

Sentence.sentence: My anchor must put the brakes on my traveling plans.
Unlike floating ice shelves which have little impact on sea level when they break up, the ice sheet is anchored to bedrock will blow the sea surface.

sentences.en: They lay at anchor outside the harbour.
Letters from home were an anchor to him when he worked abroad.
sentences.cn: 他在国外工作时, 家书是他的精神支柱。

sentences.en: They anchored their ship in the river in a foggy morning.
sentences.cn: 在一个迷雾的早晨他们把船停泊在河上。

sentences.en: The ship anchored along the shore.

means.word_mean: 担任(电视节目等的)主持人

sentences.en: She anchors the top-rated news show.
We anchored the hammock to the tree.
sentences.cn: 我们把吊床牢牢地系在树上。

sentences.en: The insect anchored fast to its prey.
sentences.cn: 这昆虫紧紧地抓住它的猎物不放。

jushi.english: They lay at anchor outside the harbor.
Letters from home were an anchor to him when he worked abroad.
jushi.chinese: 他在国外工作时,家书是他的精神支柱。

jushi.english: The ship anchored along the shore.
